title: Does evil stem from the ignorance of good? - Quora

response.answer_text: Evil stems from selfishness and the disregard of others. It comes from making us vs them distinctions that allow you to tribalism the ‘us’ and dehumanise the ‘them’ usually so we can take something ‘they’ have and give it to ‘us’. Evil is, at its core, basically a lack of empathy. Now not every person is particularly empathetic, so we develop laws the intent of which is to make people can act in a benevolent way, event when not emotionally motivated to do so.
No. To do evil, is to do wrong knowing that what you do is wrong. Certainly many bad things are indeed done from ignorance of good, but all evil things are done knowingly.

Evil is a parasite on good and a perversion of it, evil is not the opposite of good and couldn’t exist without it. Good is seen in contrast to evil: injustice, unrighteousness, lawlessness, disharmony, disunity, inequity, &c.
